item.title: Germany votes to bring back voluntary military service programme for 18-year-olds
item.description: The shift in its approach to its military follows a push to create Europe's strongest conventional army.

item.title: Western countries press Tanzania to release bodies of post-election victims
item.description: There is evidence of extrajudicial killings, disappearances and the concealment of bodies, 17 embassies say.

item.title: Netflix to buy Warner Bros film and streaming businesses for $72bn
item.description: The major Hollywood deal means Netflix will takeover ownership of franchises including Harry Potter and Game of Thrones.

item.title: Namibia loses bid to overturn ban on rhino horn trade
item.description: Namibia has built up large stockpiles of rhino horn after pioneering the practice of cutting them off to deter poachers.

item.title: Olympian and other Eritreans freed after 18 years without trial, relatives tell the BBC
item.description: Ex-cyclist Zeragaber Gebrehiwot, who attended the 1980 Moscow Games, is among 13 released from a notorious jail.
